content.description: The route is a sit start, that then moves over left to a very slick rail, then over again to a much better rail.  A hand heel match on the right rail to go up to a pinch with the right hand.  Left hand to a side pull crimp.  Left hand crossover into another crimp, right hand moves up and into a gaston on a slope, then up to another crimp.  Left up to another crimp.  Top out.
content.location: The sit start to this route is located on the far right end of the rock outcropping, marked by a VERY positive foothold and an almost squarish starting hold, a little bigger than a shoebox.  From there​ route moves left ​​​into the two rails, and then back to the right for a top out a bit to the left of the starting hold.

content.description: Secluded boulder, a fair ways off from the main trail.  No parking or use fees. Fairly bright although you are in a valley.  A nice stream flows about 30ft away.  Parking closes at sundown.
